class.name: TrainDoors
class.brief_description: This class is eligible for managing door behavior as well as their low-circuit voltage, platforms, opening, closing and controlling
class.description: This class simply coordinates door behavior

method.name: door_remote_control
method.description: Enable or disable doors remote control

method.name: next_permit_preset
method.description: Activate next permission preset. See [member TrainDoors.permit/list].

method.name: operate_doors
method.description: Open or close doors on the specified side

method.name: permit_doors
method.description: Permission to operate doors specified as an argument

method.name: previous_permit_preset
method.description: Activate previous permission preset. See [member TrainDoors.permit/list].

members.member: [code]Doors:DoorAutoCloseRemote[/code] Automatic closing of centrally open doors after a certain period of time
[code]Doors:DoorAutoCloseVel[/code] The speed at which the automatic door closing occurs
[code]Doors:DoorClosureWarningAuto[/code] When the door closing button is pressed, a buzz sound is activated automatically, and when released, the doors close
[code]Doors:DoorCloseDelay[/code] Door closing delay, in seconds
[code]Doors:CloseCtrl[/code] Determines method of closing doors
[code]Doors:CloseSpeed[/code] Animation speed for closing doors
[code]Doors:DoorClosureWarning[/code] Only a buzzer (used before closing the doors, like in EN57 EMUs)
[code]Doors:DoorBlocked[/code] Doors has locking mechanism

[code]Doors:DoorMaxShiftL[/code] or [code]Doors:DoorMaxShiftR[/code] Width (or angle) of full door opening. Note that the original simulator is using the same value for both sides. When both are provided, the simulator will use [code]DoorMaxShiftR[/code] for both sides.
[code]Doors:DoorMaxShiftPlug[/code] Bounce distance for Plug-type doors (sliding bounce), in meters
[code]Doors:MirrorVelClose[/code] Vehicle speed at which automatic closure of exterior mirrors occurs
[code]Doors:MirrorMaxShift[/code] Rotation angle for a fully unfolded mirror
[code]Doors:DoorOpenDelay[/code] Door opening delay, in seconds
[code]Doors:OpenCtrl[/code] Determines method of opening doors
[code]Doors:OpenSpeed[/code] Animation speed for opening doors
[code]Doors:DoorStayOpen[/code] Time period for which door would stay opened
[code]Doors:DoorOpenWithPermit[/code] Opening the train doors by holding down the momentary open permission button for specified number of seconds
[code]Doors:DoorsPermitLightBlinking[/code] Configuration of the permission light on the door

[code]Doors:DoorPermitList[/code] Door programmer configuration [codeblocks] 0 - No permissions 1 - Permission for left-sided doors 2 - Permission for right-sided doors 3 - Permission for both-sided doors [/codeblocks]
[code]Doors:DoorPermitListDefault[/code] By default, the position of the knob is set from the permit/list entry where the positions are numbered starting from 1
[code]Doors:DoorNeedPermit[/code] Opening the doors by passengers requires permission from the train driver
[code]Doors:PlatformMaxShift[/code] Shift value in meters or rotation angle for a fully deployed platform
[code]Doors:PlatformMaxSpeed[/code] Maximum speed of opening the platform
[code]Doors:PlatformSpeed[/code] The speed of the animation platform, where 1.0 corresponds to an animation lasting one second, the value 0.5 corresponds to two seconds, etc
[code]Doors:PlatformOpenMethod[/code] The type of the platform
[code]Doors:DoorOpenMethod[/code] Type of doors
[code]Doors:Voltage[/code] Voltage of low-voltage circuit required to control doors
